results.description: The Confluence project will develop a large research resource by 2021 to uncover breast cancer genetics through genome-wide association studies.
results.title: Confluence project for breast cancer genetics - National Cancer Institute

results.description: DCEG researchers conduct studies on breast cancer, a cancer that usually forms in the breast ducts (tubes that carry milk to the nipple) and lobules (glands that make milk). Breast cancer occurs in both men and women, although male breast cancer is rare.
results.title: DCEG researchers conduct studies on female and male breast cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The DCEG Data Science & Engineering Research Group seeks to advance research and infrastructure for data-intensive precision prevention studies.
results.title: Data Science & Engineering Research Group - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The Integrative Tumor Epidemiology Branch (ITEB) employs molecular pathology, somatic and germline genomics, and epidemiology to identify environmental and germline risk factors for cancer.
results.title: Integrative Tumor Epidemiology Research Areas - Family and Population Studies - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Dr. Montserrat García-Closas investigates the causes of cancer to improve risk assessment tools, and carries out molecular epidemiology studies of breast and bladder cancers.
results.title: Montserrat García-Closas, M.D., Dr.P.H., biographical sketch and research interests - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The DCEG Data Science Group is opening postdoctoral positions in research projects ranging from distributed machine learning to computational pathology and population science.
results.title: Data Science for Cancer Research and Precision Prevention – Postdoctoral Fellowship - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Master list of breast cancer studies in the Integrative Tumor Epidemiology Branch
results.title: Breast Cancer Studies in the Integrative Tumor Epidemiology Branch - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Catherine Schairer, senior staff scientist in the Metabolic Epidemiology Branch (MEB) retired from DCEG in September 2019, after 37 years of service.
results.title: Catherine Schairer Retires from DCEG - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The Laboratory of Translational Genomics, the Laboratory of Genetic Susceptibility, and the Cancer Genomics Research Laboratory joined the rest of the Division staff as occupants of a new constructed state of the art laboratory and staff building at Shady Grove.
results.title: Laboratory-based Research Groups of DCEG Move to NCI Shady Grove Campus - National Cancer Institute
